name: TheAtlantic
text: Hulu's "The Great" satirizes 18th-century Russian politics, portraying a disturbing leadership style that resembles the White House's response to the pandemic, writes @shirklesxp. https://t.co/sPfv6d5pVK

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Backlashes appear as seemingly serial and discrete events—against the civil-rights movement in the 1960s, or the women’s movement in the ’70s, or the gay-rights movement in the ’90s. But this obscures an underlying continuity," @LarryGlickman writes. https://t.co/ueZALqcEow

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @jameshamblin: Important investigative work from my colleagues @alexismadrigal and @yayitsrob on artificially high testing numbers. Combining viral and antibody tests into one metric is meaningless and dangerously misleading. @TheAtlantic https://t.co/53tom7tKvx

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @davidfrum: In @TheAtlantic today, an excerpt adapted from "Trumocalypse," which releases next week. 

https://t.co/OhLh2Hv8pO https://t.co/UmmFRrOQru

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: While reporting on epidemics in DRCongo, I often heard people resignedly joking about the fictional 15th article of the country’s constitution: “Débrouillez-vous" or “Figure it out yourself.” That's now the perfect summary of America's national plan. 

https://t.co/n33jpJkNp7

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: Around the world, governments are decrying opposition and criticism as nitpicking, destabilizing, or even traitorous. That's not true. As @helenlewis writes, opposition is needed now more than ever. https://t.co/R3yKC5gp8r

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: As China's leaders ready for the National People's Congress, a "sense of country" is forming in Hong Kong—and that’s a problem for Beijing. @ssataline has more: https://t.co/wVgKUcRNdb

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hong Kong's residents are forging bonds that challenge Beijing's notion of patriotism. That "sense of country" is a challenge to China, writes @ssataline. https://t.co/i9dmA3fCZJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump is a swindler, but the Trumpocalypse of 2020 represents something a lot bigger and a lot worse than a swindle," @davidfrum writes. https://t.co/br0yR0VhL4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Most voters are basing their assessments of Trump’s performance in the pandemic less on their actual daily experiences and more on their preexisting viewpoints about his tumultuous and norm-shattering presidency," @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/1C2a6jS1Em

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: For 2020, education remains a more important dividing line among whites than gender-as it was in 2016. Here's why. https://t.co/90p6qaXtw5

name: TheAtlantic
text: With varying lockdowns in place, and safety measures enacted by local communities, the Muslim holy month of Ramadan has been observed very differently around the world this year. From @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/JimmITE26t

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Ramadan 2020: A Holy Month During a Pandemic - 27 images from around the world, of holy observances during a time of lockdowns and social distancing.  https://t.co/Ga1mxKz0tK https://t.co/fQKIZEZI9s

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Most voters are basing their assessments of Trump’s performance in the pandemic less on their actual daily experiences and more on their preexisting viewpoints about his tumultuous and norm-shattering presidency," @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/e6SIAssGX0

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SStossel: "The 1918 virus killed more people than the deadliest war humanity had hitherto experienced, but it did not reduce humanity’s determination to socialize." https://t.co/a4Ox3Kq8WD

name: TheAtlantic
text: “How could the CDC make that mistake?” Experts say that combining the results of different COVID-19 tests created a flawed view of the pandemic, @alexismadrigal and @yayitsrob report: https://t.co/niGH97NXPF
